holidays.name: National Whipped Cream Day
holidays.description: A delightful day dedicated to celebrating the fluffy, sweet topping that brings joy to pies, hot chocolate, and desserts everywhere.
holidays.origin: Started as a fun promotional day by whipped cream companies, it has become a favorite among dessert lovers.
holidays.funFact: Did you know that the first can of aerosol whipped cream was invented in 1948 by a dairy company? Now that's some serious innovation for dessert fans!

holidays.name: Bird Day
holidays.description: A day to appreciate and protect our feathered friends, encouraging bird watching and conservation efforts worldwide.
holidays.origin: First observed in 1894, Bird Day was created to promote the protection and appreciation of birds and their habitats.
holidays.funFact: Bird Day predates Earth Day by over 75 years, making it one of the earliest days dedicated to environmental conservation!

holidays.name: National Bird Day
holidays.description: Another avian appreciation day but observed specifically to support bird adoption from shelters and educate on pet bird needs.
holidays.origin: Established in 2002 by the Avian Welfare Coalition to increase awareness of pet birds and avian rescue.
holidays.funFact: On National Bird Day, many bird shelters see an increase in adoptions due to heightened awareness and education efforts.

holidays.name: Epiphany Eve/ Twelfth Night
holidays.description: The night before Epiphany, celebrated with various cultural traditions marking the end of the Christmas season, often involving parties and unique customs.
holidays.origin: Rooted in Christian tradition, Twelfth Night marks the eve before Epiphany, when the Three Wise Men visited baby Jesus.
holidays.funFact: In some cultures, eating a 'Twelfth Night Cake' with a hidden bean or coin is traditional; whoever finds it becomes 'king' or 'queen' for the night!
